The Quality Improvement Collaborative is aimed at improving uptake of pediatric ART in high volume health facilities across several Local government areas (LGAs) in the 32 high burden LGAs and selected high volume sites in an LGAs in the initial seven high HIV prevalent and high burdened states in Nigeria. The collaborative will implement innovative strategies to improve case finding, improved linkage and access to viral load in the selected sites. We will use QI collaborative methodologies for intensified monitoring and enhanced mentorship to improve performance. The focus will be to improved case detection, special focus on index testing and other high yielding entry points, prompt linkage to ART implementing same-day ART, improve adherence and retention on ART, identification of barriers to access and bottlenecks to service uptake, and selected sites to enjoy intensified mentoring and monitoring. The overall goal is to increase uptake of pediatric ART in selected sites by 50% over the sites FY17 achievements. The Collaborative would bring together teams from selected facilities and agencies that constitute their referral sites, including but not limited to secondary and ANC clinics, immunization programs, OVC programs, TB clinics, infant welfare programs and HCT programs. Teams will test multiple change activities, which will result in evidence-based improvement activities that can be replicated in other facilities. If the initiative is successful, it can be spread to other areas of Nigeria, or applied to other areas of care where gaps in performance are identified.
